questions.question: Identify the error in the sentence: 'If you will be late, the teacher gets angry.'
Which sentence uses the first conditional correctly?
options: If you won’t study, you don't pass the test.
If you not study, you will fail.
If you don’t study, you will fail.
If you didn’t study, you will fail.
questions.answer: If you don’t study, you will fail.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'If Mark ___ the meeting, he'll miss important updates.'
Select the grammatically correct conditional sentence:
options: If I will see her, I tell her the news.
If I see her, I will tell her the news.
If I seeing her, I will tell the news.
If I saw her, I will tell her the news.
questions.answer: If I see her, I will tell her the news.
